question: In your opinion, what could be improved?
response: I had trouble doing the steps for 9  Installing R packages (pak::pak("rostools/r3", upgrade = TRUE) and below). The problem was not R or RStudio, but a Windows group policy that blocked external executables used by the pak package. This caused repeated installation failures.The solution that worked was to avoid pak entirely and install all required packages manually using base R (install.packages()) and remotes::install_github(). By replacing r3::install_packages_introduction() with a manual, curated package list, everything installed and loaded correctly.I tried it on my private computer as well. Here the problem ws "could not find tools necessary to compile a package call 'pkgbuild::check_build_tools(debut = TRUE)'
